definition: lit. twice every three days (idiom); practically every day/frequently
surname San
three/3
day/sky/heaven
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns

sentences.english: The sick child every two or three days, I often run to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 孩子三天兩頭的生病，我就隔三差五的往醫院裏跑。

sentences.english: We live out of suitcases, and we serve hundreds of meals each day.
sentences.chinese: 我們三天兩頭旅行，每天要供應幾百份飯。

sentences.english: She three day does 2 go toward to run what in butcher shop?
sentences.chinese: 她三天兩頭往肉鋪裏跑什麼？

sentences.english: Almost every day I can see mothers making children water the crops.
sentences.chinese: 三天兩頭的，就能看到媽媽領着孩子忙着給菜地澆水。

definition: delicate
sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
to go into a huff
to be in a bad mood
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to get angry
to chatter/to babble

to enumerate sb's shortcomings/to criticize/to scold/to talk on and on
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
what remains unseen is deemed to be clean/what the eye doesn't see, the heart doesn't grieve over (idiom)
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
damn thing/(not one's) goddamn business
docile and obedient/all obedience
